thread.title: Live Updates: Anti-Government protest kicks off as thousands of Nigerians gather in Lagos, Abuja (photos,video) - NAIJ.COM
thread.title_full: Live Updates: Anti-Government protest kicks off as thousands of Nigerians gather in Lagos, Abuja (photos,video) - NAIJ.COM

title: Live Updates: Anti-Government protest kicks off as thousands of Nigerians gather in Lagos, Abuja (photos,video) - NAIJ.COM
text: Share on Facebook Nigerians have started to gather at the National Stadium one of the venues of the nationwide protest. The massive nationwide protest against the federal government today February, 6 was announced by music star 2baba Idibia. The protest was earlier championed by the musician but on Saturday, February 4; he released a video saying he was cancelling the protest due to security concern. The singer said the protest was never his creation but a call to action to speak up for his people. In spite of the cancellation, some Nigerians vowed to continue with the protest. In Lagos, the protesters are expected to march from National Stadium in Surulere to the National Theatre, Iganmu. The protest is also set to take place simultaneously in Abuja, Enugu and Port Harcourt, among other major cities. Naij.com will be bringing you live updates of the protest. 01.33 pm: The protest has officially ended peacefully with protesters gathering at the National Theatre, Iganmu. Moremi Ojudu, daughter of Babafemi Ojudu, the special adviser to President Muhammadu Buhari on politics with Charly Boy and Sahara Reporters publisher, Omoyele Sowore at the protest. 12.12 pm: The former chairman of the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) is at the Unity Fountain, venue of the #IstandwithNigeria protest in Abuja. Protesters in Abuja marching and singing solidarity songs Also present at the Lagos protest are Moremi Ojudu daughter to a senior aide to President Muhammadu Buhari, the Commissioner of Police (CP) in Lagos state, Fatai Owoseni and Dolapo Badmus, the spokesperson of the Lagos State Police Command. Moremi Ojudu, Sowore, others join protest against President Muhammadu Buhari’s government In Abuja, Aisha Yesufu of the BringBackOurGirls campaign is speaking at the #IStandWithNigeria protest. She is talking of the need to be respectful all through the protest. Co convener of the Bring Back Our Girls group, Aisha Yesufu at the march as protesters sing solidarity Aisha Yesufu and protetsers stopped by police from reaching Nigeria’s presidential villa in Abuja 10.40 am: The procession leaves the National Stadium for Ojuelegba under bridge ahead of the march to National Theatre 10.20 am: Charly Boy on his way to join other celebrities at the National Stadium 10.14 am: Sahara Reporters publisher, Omoyele Sowore came into the stadium chanting Sahara Reporters publisher, Omoyele Sowore chanting songs at the national stadium 9.32 am: Nollywood actor Baaj Adebule and comedian, Seyilaw are present at the stadium. Comedian SeyiLaw joins protesters at the National Stadium 9.14 am: The Executive Director EiENigeria, Yemi Adamolekun, speaking to media before the protest moves from National Stadium. 9.08 am: Stadium gates were closed but they are now open with more citizens gathering. Protesters in Lagos on their way to National Theatre, Iganmu 9.00 am : Nigerians have started to gather at the stadium to drive home their demands. 8.06 am: About 15 police vehicles have been spotted in the stadium with one armoured tank outside the premises though the protest has not started yet. Police officers at the venue of the protest to ensure peace and order 8.00 am: Protesters gathered at the national stadium before the march started Protesters carrying placards and chanting in front of the National stadium Related Stories
